Hints: For help, see tutorial in HandsOnDataViz.org      --->
Show title at top of Polygon legend (or leave blank)
Insert a Font Awesome icon (or leave blank)
Polygon file pathname in your GitHub repo, or external web address (or blank if no polygon data)
When a polygon is clicked, display "img" property in geoJSON, if available.
Show a polygon property label at zoom levels listed below (or leave blank for none)

Setting: Show Polygon Labels at Zoom Level
Hints: Polygon property label will appear at this zoom level and above
Select 'on' to display polygon data on map startup, or 'off'
For help, see tutorial in HandsOnDataViz.org      --->

List each polygon Property-Label pair, separated by a comma, to appear in the colored map. The Property is the column header in the GeoJSON file, and the Label is the wording you wish to display in the legend (example: pop2010, Population 2010). To show multiple Property-Label pairs, separate them with a semicolon, but none at the end.

List the range of dividers (separated by commas) for each Property-Label pair above. Use numerical dividers (example: 0, 50, 100), which will appear in your legend with dashes (0-50, 50-100, 100+). Or use text dividers (example: low, medium, high) if these values appear in your polygon data. Use no more than 9 dividers per range. Insert one range for each Property-Label pair shown above. Separate multiple ranges with a semicolon, but none at the end.
List each Property-Label pair to display as pop-up text when the polygon is clicked. Separate multiple pairs with a semicolon, but none at the end.
For help, see tutorial in HandsOnDataViz.org      --->
Select a ColorBrewer palette to automatically color each Property Range listed above (and/or select colors manually below).

Leave blank to use the automatic Color Palette above, OR manually insert a color, followed by a comma, for each divider in each Range above. Use either color words (example: lightgray, lightblue, blue) or hex codes (example: #efedf5, #bcbddc, #756bb1). The number of colors must match the number of dividers in each range. Separate multiple ranges with a semicolon, but none at the end.
Insert number between 0 (transparent) and 1 (opaque), or leave blank for default (0.7).
Insert a color word (example: black) or hex code, or leavel blank for default (white).
